Package com.ecrowson.Chess

Class Check

java.lang.Object
com.ecrowson.Chess.Check
public class Check extends Object
Contains the logic associated with legalising possible moves on the board.
Author:
Ethan Crowson

  • Method Details

    • LegaliseMoves

      public ArrayList<Tile> LegaliseMoves(Tile[][] board, Tile kingTile, ArrayList<Tile> pseudoLegalMoves, Piece testPiece, int file, int rank, boolean turnWhite)
      Takes an array list of pseudo legal moves and returns an arraylist of only the legal ones.
      Parameters:
      board - the playing board constructed from tiles.
      kingTile - the tile with the king needed for observing check.
      pseudoLegalMoves - the array list of psuedo legal moves.
      testPiece - the piece whose moves are being legalised.
      file - the file of the tile the piece is currently occupying.
      rank - the rank of the tile the piece is currently occupying.
      turnWhite - the boolean representing whose turn it is (W/B).
      Returns:
      the legal moves the piece can play.

    • checkMate

      public int checkMate(Tile[][] board, Tile kingTile, boolean turnWhite, LinkedList<Piece> ps)
      Returns whether there is a checkmate on the board or not.
      Parameters:
      board - the playing board constructed from tiles.
      kingTile - the tile with the king needed for observing checkmate.
      turnWhite - the boolean representing whose turn it is (W/B).
      ps - a linked list of all of the pieces on the board.
      Returns:
      if the game is still playing/ in stalemate/ in checkmate.
